choices.C: HA management interface settings are synchronized between cluster members.
choices.D: Heartbeat interfaces are not required on the primary device.
choices.B: Virtual clustering can be configured between two FortiGate devices that have multiple VDOMs.
choices.A: Sessions handled by proxy-based security profiles cannot be synchronized.

questions.question_text: Which statements about HA for FortiGate devices are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
I also would choose A & B. C were not bad, if you configure a cluster management IP, but otherwise, the mgmt is dedicated per member. 
A: "Session-pickup has some limitations. For example, the FGCP does not support session failover for sessions being scanned by proxy-based security profiles. Session" 
I assume, this is valid not only for the 6000
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate-6000/6.0.4/fortigate-6000-handbook/686471/session-failover-session-pickup
A & B regarding FG Infrastructure Study Guide 6.4 (page 327)

comments.content:
Fortigate Study Guide 6.0 pages: 301 and 312:
ONLY sessions not being handled by proxy based sec profile can be syncronized
Virtual Clustering: You can use virtual clustering to manually distribute traffic between two cluster devices.

Sorry B & C is correct after reading below, it takes out A
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.2.0/cookbook/869218/fgsp-session-synchronization-peer-setup

discussion.content:
C is correct :)
HA management interface will be enabled automatically on slave unit and interface will be configured same as Master.

choices.D: FortiGate is in flow-based inspection mode.
choices.A: FortiGate needs to be switched to NGFW mode.
choices.C: Proxy options are no longer available starting in FortiOS 5.6.
choices.B: Proxy options section is hidden by default and needs to be enabled from the Feature Visibility menu.

discussion.content: D might be correct if they mean the proxy feature support for MAPI and CDR, which are actual only available, if the AV profile is set to proxy-based mode
D. FortiGate is in flow-based inspection mode.

questions.question_text: An administrator is configuring an antivirus profiles on FortiGate and notices that Proxy Options is not listed under Security Profiles on the GUI. What can cause this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A, see clash value

The value of clash is higher than 0, meaning it's experiencing NAT port exhaustion.
Correct answer is A!

The correct answer is A. FortiGate_Security_6.2_Study_Guide-Online (page 188), it says: 
"NAT port exhaustion is also highlighted by a rise in the clash counter from the diagnose system session stat command."
A, Nat port exhaustion = clash counter.

choices.B: This VPN cannot be used as part of a hub-and-spoke topology.
choices.D: The IPsec firewall policies must be placed at the top of the list.
choices.C: A virtual IPsec interface is automatically created after the phase 1 configuration is completed.
choices.A: A phase 2 configuration is not required.

questions.question_text: An administrator has configured a route-based IPsec VPN between two FortiGate devices. Which statement about this IPsec VPN configuration is true?

choices.A: The VPN is configured to use pre-shared key authentication.
choices.C: Remote is the host name of the remote IPsec peer.
